info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 3:18PM EST until January 07 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally over one foot possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Michigan. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and roads may become impassible at times. The hazardous conditions will impact commutes today into Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A dominant band of heavy lake effect snow currently mostly off shore from Manistee to Whitehall and comes on shore just north of Holland a 3 pm. This band will become more north to south oriented after dark. This will result in many hours of steady heavy snow where this band comes on shore. Locations near and south of South Haven, near US-31 have the greatest risk of getting 1 to 2 feet of snow by Friday morning. Just inland of that there could be a more widespread 3 to 6 inches into the central parts of both counties. Extreme western Kalamazoo County could see the eastern edge of that snow band. Over Ottawa County, all of the county will see heavy snow early this evening but only the lake shore , near US-31 will see significant snow overnight. This will significantly impact the commute Friday morning in those areas.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
